bug.short_desc: ssl::server_name ACL badly broken since inception
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Please consider releasing Squid 4.0.16, there have been a large number of bugs fixed in upstream since 4.0.11 and one in particular is causing me problems.
From 4.0.16 changelog, ssl::server_name ACL badly broken since inception (trunk r14008).
This bug means bypassing of peek-n-splice SSL inspection using ACL's is broken. The functionality is required for certain sites such as windows update. The rules were happily working in fc24 squid 3.5.20, before I upgraded to fc25.
Thank you, Andrew Peek
squid-4.0.16-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-6009aca927

squid-4.0.16-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-6009aca927

Lubos,
Thank you for making 4.0.16 available, this update does indeed fix the acl problem reported. Peek-n-spice is working again as expected.
Regards Andrew
